intro: Rhipsalis villigera, commonly known as the silver mist cactus, is a species of epiphytic cactus native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its long, flexible stems that often trail or hang from trees, forming a cascading appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically borne in clusters during the winter months. Its leaves are reduced to small, hair-like structures, and it lacks the typical spines found in many cacti. Rhipsalis villigera is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant indoors.
